Skills

Certified Microsoft Office Specialist Word 2016

Microsoft Word 2016 Certification exam earners have a fundamental understanding of the Word environment and the ability to complete tasks independently. Earners demonstrated the principal features of Word 2016 by creating and editing a large project which can include professional-looking reports, multi-column newsletters, résumés, and business correspondence. Earners may include students, business information workers, clerical workers, educators, and others.

Good Communication Ability

Can do work across many teams and groups and also has the ability to provide tech solutions for people who are not as savvy. Can display leadership at all level of projects, and with many different groups composed with the ability to provide present ideas and reports in larger groups of people.

Time Management Expert

Have the ability to accurately assess how long a project would take and has the ability to stick to those timelines not only for himself but also for the whole team's time schedule. Can do multiple task and is willing to step up and to go further than the given task.

Analytical Ability

Can find logical solutions to problems and diagnose technology issues to be fixed. Has the skill to figure out why a line of code isn't yielding a desired result or why a server's down. Can help in identifying a problem before it arises and read, pivot tables in spreadsheet, identify trends over time and identify key performance indicators with the thought of learning how to identify critical events and eliminate outliers from data sets.
